723439f-a.title: Manhattan: Stuyvesant Square Park - [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).]
723439f-a.text:
Stuyvesant Sduare Park, looking northwest through the gate on 15th
Street east of Second Avenue.
The Lying-In Hospital, on the N.W. corner of Second Avenue and 17th
Street, is shown in the background.
Summer 1923.
P. L. Sperr.
N1en w 045
723439f-a.folder: Stuyvesant Square Park & [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).], Manhattan, NY

723438f-b.title: Manhattan: Stuyvesant Square Park - [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).]
723438f-b.text:
Stuyvesant Square Park: An open area between East 15th (right, southern boundary) and East 17th (left, northern boundary) Streets, that is bisected by Second Ave. The eastern side of same, as shown with the Beth Israel Hospital thereon, is Livingston Place. On the lower left appears the nave and bell-tower of St. Georges P.E. Church, located on the western edge, which is called Rutherford Place. This park, a portion of the former Stuyvesant Farm was bequeathed to the City by Peter Stuyvesant. The Park Department in conjunction with the W.P.A. attempted to improve same in 1936, as a playground for East Side children, but were restrained by the various hospitals in this vicinity. Their plea being based upon the original grant of land; "for park purposes." E judicial decree was granted in their favor. For further data, see newspapers for 1936-1937. Photographers vantage point is the Consolidated Edison Building, No. 4 Irving Place and shows an eastward perspective across the "Gas House" area of Manhattan to Greenpoint, Brooklyn. Separating these localities of the City is the East River.
September 23, 1930.
723438f-b.folder: Stuyvesant Square Park & [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).], Manhattan, NY

723437f-a.title: Manhattan: Stuyvesant Square Park - [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).]
723437f-a.text:
Stuyvesant Park: A small park between E. 15th E 17th Street's bisected by Second Avenue. Photo No. 1 is in a northwesbward direction from a point noar Second Ave. and 16th Street. At the left is the darkened shadow of St. Ceorges Church on Rutherford Place. No. 2 is taken in the easterly half of the park and is southoastward in direction. The buildings there are on Livingston Place and run from 16th (laft) to 15th Sts.
About 1935
No's. 1-2
Gift of the Committee on Housing
Charity Organization Society
723437f-a.folder: Stuyvesant Square Park & [Between 15th and 17th Streets (East).], Manhattan, NY
